Subset_Questions.ID: What is the ID of the Subset?
Subset_Questions.Name: What is the name of the subset?
Subset_Questions.LastUpdate: When was the subset last updated?
Subset_Questions.Modality: What is the modality of the subset? (The type of data)
Subset_Questions.Format: What is the format or the schema of the subset?
Subset_Questions.Size: What is the size of the subset? (Number of rows if it's a table or files if it's a directory)
Subset_Questions.Parent: What is the ID of the parent of the subset? (Use 0 if none)
Subset_Questions.Purpose: What is the purpose of the subset?
Subset_Questions.Link: What is the link (URL) to further description of the subset?
Subset_Questions.Covmat: Have you calculated a covariance matrix (or similar) and made it available in this dataset? Where?
Subset_Questions.Modsys: Have you modeled all (or a few) features and made the models accessible in this dataset? Where?

Feature_Questions.ID: What is the ID of the feature?
Feature_Questions.Subset: What is the ID of the reference subset of the feature?
Feature_Questions.Introduction: What is the introduction date of the feature?
Feature_Questions.Name: What is the name of the feature?
Feature_Questions.Values: What are the values that the feature might take?
Feature_Questions.Meaning_NA_NULL_NONE_OTHER: What special meaning does NA, NULL, NONE, or any other placeholder have with respect to this feature?
Feature_Questions.Meaning_Zero: What is the meaning of the feature if it is zero?
Feature_Questions.Meaning_BlankVoid: What does it mean if no value is to be found?
Feature_Questions.Sparsity: What level of non-zero sparsity is there?
Feature_Questions.Mean: What is the mean if the feature is nummeric?
Feature_Questions.Std: What is the standard deviation if the feature is numeric?
Feature_Questions.Modality: How many modes does the feature have?
Feature_Questions.IQR: What is the inter quartile range?
Feature_Questions.ParentIDs: What is the ID of the parent feature (If derived from other features)
Feature_Questions.Unit: What unit is this feature in?
Feature_Questions.Purpose: Why does the feature exist or is it superfluous?
Feature_Questions.Encoding: State whether the feature is encoded and what the mapping is.

Subset_1.Name: Medication raw
Subset_1.Purpose: Detailed information on all ordinations of ATC-codes: J01", "J02", "J04", "J05", "A07", "R02", "L03", "L04", "H02","L01"

Feature_1.Name: Timestamp
Feature_1.Meaning_Zero: Zero means no treatment with drug within period
Feature_1.Definition: Start date and end date of drug ordination
Feature_1.Purpose: Used to calculate length of treatment at calculate "time to fecal sample". (Obs.: Can be messy and double ordinations may occur. This is mostly solved by cleaning script).

Feature_2.Name: Data on drug
Feature_2.Definition: name, ATC-code, dosis, way of administration of specific drug

Feature_3.Name: Ordination-ID
Feature_3.Definition: Each ordination has a specific ID called Best./ord.-ID

Subset_2.Name: Medication cleaned
Subset_2.Purpose: Cleaned mediacl data where timeperiod and drugs of interest can be defined.

Feature_1.Name: Drug data
Feature_1.Meaning_Zero: Zero means no treatment with drug within period
Feature_1.Definition: Name of drug and days of treatment within desired interval prior to donation of fecal sample
Feature_1.Purpose: Used to qualify and quantify treatment prior to fecal sample. ATC-codes avaliable: "J01", "J02", "J04", "J05", "A07", "R02", "L03", "L04", "H02","L01" (Antibiotics and immune modulators)

Feature_2.Name: Sample_ID
Feature_2.Definition: Each fecal sample has a specific ID
Feature_2.Purpose: Used to map each feacl sample to patient ID and microbiome outcome

Subset_3.Name: Microbiome_raw
Subset_3.Purpose: Raw data from illumina sequencing protocol

Feature_1.Name: Sample_ID
Feature_1.Definition: Each fecal sample has a specific ID
Feature_1.Purpose: Used to map each feacl sample to patient ID and microbiome outcome

Feature_2.Name: Fastq files
Feature_2.Purpose: The basis of our microbiome research

Subset_4.Name: PGP output
Subset_4.Purpose: Files generated by running our PGP pipeline on fastq files

Feature_1.Name: Sample_ID
Feature_1.Definition: Each fecal sample has a specific ID
Feature_1.Purpose: Used to map each feacl sample to patient ID and microbiome outcome

Feature_2.Name: Antibiotic resistance genes
Feature_2.Definition: For each gene the number of mappings is normalized to the total number for 16s genes in the samples
Feature_2.Purpose: Used to identify and quantify antibiotic resistance genes in each sample. Normalized to 16s genes to enable comparissons between samples.

Feature_3.Name: ARG diversity and gene richness
Feature_3.Definition: Diversity and gene richness calculated based on ARGs in each sample
Feature_3.Purpose: Used to collapse all ARGs into overall measures comparable between samples.

Feature_4.Name: Taxonomy
Feature_4.Definition: Mapping of reads to bacterial taxa. Normalized to genome length and total amount of non human reads in each sample
Feature_4.Purpose: Used to identify and quantify bacterial composition of each sample.

Feature_5.Name: Taxonomical diversity and richness
Feature_5.Definition: Diversity and gene richness calculated based on bacterial species in each sample
Feature_5.Purpose: Used to collapse all bacterial reads into overall measures comparable between samples.

Feature_6.Name: Genetic functionality
Feature_6.Definition: Name of genetic functionality and number of mappings
Feature_6.Purpose: Used to identify and quantify bacterial genetic functionalities

Subset_5.Name: Clinical outcomes
Subset_5.Purpose: Detailed information on clinical outcomes from PERSIMUNE data lake

Feature_2.Name: Sample_ID
Feature_2.Definition: Each fecal sample has a specific ID
Feature_2.Purpose: Used to map each feacl sample to patient ID and microbiome outcome

Feature_3.Name: Conditioning
Feature_3.Purpose: Conditioning regiment have impact on the microbiome and numerous other patient outcomes

Feature_4.Name: GVHD
Feature_4.Definition: Did the patient devellop graft vs. host disease
Feature_4.Purpose: aGVHD is a servere complication to HSCT and propably has an extented interplay with the gutmircobiome trough components the immunesystem

Feature_5.Name: Engraftment
Feature_5.Purpose: The date of engraftment is when the immunesystem is reconstructed after HSCT. This is a curcial timepoint in understanding HSCT-patients.

Subset_6.Name: Demographics
Subset_6.Purpose: data on social/societal, economic, sex, or historical medical events from LPR

Feature_1.Name: Age
Feature_1.Purpose: Used to stratify for potential age specific traits

Feature_2.Name: Sex
Feature_2.Purpose: Used to stratify for potential gender specific traits

Subset_7.Name: Laboratory values
Subset_7.Purpose: Detailed information on laboratory values outcomes from PERSIMUNE data lake

Feature_1.Name: Laboratory values
Feature_1.Purpose: Many laboratory values will probably correlate to microbiomestatus. Some will be irrelevant.
